A '''leather cap'''{{fn|Also known as a '''leather hat''' in [[Language#Differences between English dialects|British English]].}} is a variant of [[helmet]] that is crafted from [[leather]]. It is the eighth-highest [[tier]] of helmet, having the lowest armor points and durability. Like all [[leather armor]], it can be [[dye]]d and protects the wearer from [[freezing]].

=== Mob loot ===
[[Zombie]]s, [[husk]]s, [[skeleton]]s, [[stray]]s, and [[bogged]] have a small chance to spawn wearing armor, which may include a leather cap. There is a 8.5% chance (9.5% with [[Looting]] I, 10.5% with Looting II and 11.5% with Looting III) for the mob to drop the cap they're wearing upon death. The dropped cap is usually badly damaged, and may be [[enchanted]] with enchantment levels 5-19.

=== Trading ===
{{Trade sources}}

== Usage ==
When worn, a leather cap provides {{armor|1}} [[armor point]].

==== Powder snow ====
As with all pieces of leather armor, wearing a leather cap protects the player from freezing in [[powder snow]].

=== Repairing ===
==== Combining ====
{{Crafting|Damaged Leather Cap|Damaged Leather Cap

|Damaged Leather Cap|Damaged Leather Cap|Leather Cap|description=The durability of the two caps is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
}}

==== Unit repair ====
{{main|Anvil mechanics#Unit repair}}
{{Repairing
| head=1
| Damaged Leather Cap
| Damaged Leather Cap; Leather
| Leather Cap
| tail=1
}}

A leather cap can be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[leather]], with each leather restoring 25% the cap's maximum durability, rounded down. Two helmets of the same tier can also be combined in an anvil. Both methods preserve the cap's [[enchantment]]s.

=== Armor trimming ===
It is possible to upgrade armor with trims. This requires a [[smithing template]], a leather cap, and an ingot or crystal ([[iron ingot]], [[copper ingot]], [[gold ingot]], [[netherite ingot]], [[emerald]], [[redstone dust]], [[lapis lazuli]], [[amethyst shard]], [[nether quartz]], [[diamond]], or [[resin brick]]).

These trims have no effect on the gameplay or strength of the armor.
{{Smithing
|head=1
|ingredients=Any Armor Trim +<br>Leather Cap +<br>Any Ingot/Crystal
|Any Armor Trim Smithing Template

|Amethyst Trim Leather Cap; Copper Trim Leather Cap; Diamond Trim Leather Cap; Emerald Trim Leather Cap; Gold Trim Leather Cap; Iron Trim Leather Cap; Lapis Trim Leather Cap; Quartz Trim Leather Cap; Netherite Trim Leather Cap; Redstone Trim Leather Cap
|tail=1
}}

=== Dyeing ===
{{main|Dye#Dyeing armor}}

Leather caps can be dyed by combining it with [[dye]](s) through crafting {{in|java}}, or by {{control|using}} it on a [[cauldron]] containing dyed [[water]] {{in|bedrock}}. {{control|Using}} dyed leather caps on a cauldron containing ordinary water removes any dye from it.
